intro: Galium tarmense, commonly known as Tarmian bedstraw, is a flowering plant species native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit. The plant features small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the summer months. Its leaves are opposite and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are slender and branched. Galium tarmense is often found in dry grasslands and rocky areas, adapting well to arid environments.
